title.narrative: ENHANCED NATIONAL CAPACITY AND EVIDENCEGENERATION

description.narrative: The country has strengthened its capacity to implement gender-sensitive child-sensitive policies and procedures, and strategic stakeholders have more evidence on child protection issues., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, girls and boys, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from a child protection system that effectively protects them from violence, abuse and exploitation, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The country has strengthened its capacity to implement gender-sensitive child-sensitive policies and procedures, and strategicstakeholders have more evidence on child protection issues.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to advocate for the;finalization;of the National Child Protection Code;which was delayed;in;2021;due to suggested revisions proposed by the new;Government. UNICEF supported the;roll-out;of the;revised;National;Child Protection Policy, national guidelines on alternative care;and;the development of the national strategy on street children. Child-rights monitors recorded;7,087 child rights violations and provided;relevant assistance to victims and witnesses.;The;Child;Helpline;provided;referral and counselling support to 10,564 children in distress.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2021
